p: Essential oils are usually detached from aqueous phase through a physical process that does not significantly affect their composition. Characteristically appearing in their liquid, volatile, limpid and rarely colored form, essential oils also display a good solubility in lipids and organic solvents, often having lower densities than that of water [ 81]. Odorous secondary metabolite biosynthesis in Mentha species occurs in peltate glandular trichomes, specialized epidermal tissues located on leaves, stems, petals and seed coat surfaces, depending on the species [ 59, 60].
